statement.p: John is conducting market research on the cost of homeowners insurance. John has determined that the average annual cost of homeowners insurance is 1199, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 59.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 1257 on homeowners insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 80 of homeowners insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 10 of homeowners insurance policies cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 80 of the data, need the remaining 20 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution. So the lower bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.1} of the area to the left and the upper bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.1} of the area to the right, which means \displaystyle{0.9} to the left.
